intro: Ornithogalum orthophyllum subsp. orthophyllum, commonly known as the white star lily, is a bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulb, which stores nutrients for growth. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
